titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Western Silent Films Lobby Card Collection
Western Silent Films Lobby Card Collection
titlestmt.author: by Kathleen T. Burns

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 07:08

did.unittitle: Western silent films lobby card collection

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection consists of 105 items (86 lobby cards and 19 printed fliers) promoting sixty-eight films, mostly silent westerns, from the 1910's and 1920's. Lobby cards and fliers include both photographic and artistic renderings of scenes and characters from the publicized film.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Walter Reuben on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 2006.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Western Silent Films Lobby Card Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Western Silent Films Lobby Card Collection. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Western Silent Films Lobby Cards Collection consists of 106 printed items used to promote silent and western films, ca. 1910-ca. 1930. 87 lobby cards and 19 printed fliers have been arranged alphabetically under each film title. Titles of lobby cards were transcribed from captions or supplied if no caption was present. The lobby cards and publicity fliers include both photographic and artistic renderings of scenes and characters from the film being publicized.
Sixty-eight silent films are represented in the collection as well as an early sound motion picture released in 1928, The Trail of '98 .

Complete lobby card sets (consisting of eight 11 x 14 lobby cards) are present for The Covered Wagon , a 1923 silent western starring J. Warren Kerrigan and Lois Wilson; The Thundering Herd , a 1925 film based on Zane Grey's novel featuring Jack Holt, Lois Wilson, and Noah Beery; and The Tough Guy , a 1926 western that billed Fred Thomson, Lola Todd, and Silver King the Horse as leads. Fred Thomson and Silver King the Horse are also promoted as leads in The Sunset Legion , The Two-Gun Man , and The Wild Bull's Lair . Other non-human actors represented in the collection include Rex the Wonder Horse (in a flier for 1927's No Man's Law ) and Ranger the Dog (in a flier for 1929's The One Man Dog ).

Movie actors featured in more than one film title in the collection include Art Acord ( The Circus Cylcone (1925), Custer's Last Fight (1912), The Squaw Man (1914), Three in Exile (1925), The Western Rover (1927)); Noah Beery ( In Mizzoura (1919), Wanderer of the Wasteland (1924)); Harry Carrey ( The Flaming Forties (1924), The Fox (1921), Good Men and True (1922)); Franklyn Farnum ( Smiling Jim (1922), Wolves of the Border (1923)); William S. Hart ( The Disciple (1915), The Testing Block (1920), White Oak (1921)); Jack Holt ( The Enchanted Hill (1926), Wanderer of the Wasteland (1924), The Water Hole (1928)); Jack Hoxie ( Lightning Bryce (1919), Wolf Tracks (1923)); Tom Mix ( The Great K & A Train Robbery (1926), The Rainbow Trail (1925)); Buddy Roosevelt ( The Bandit Buster (1926), The Ramblin' Galoot (1926)); and Ted Wells ( The Smiling Terror (1929), Thunder Riders (1928)).

Other movie actors that appear in the collection include Roscoe "Fatty" Arbuckle in The Round-Up and Douglas Fairbanks in The Mollycoddle (1920). Also present are lobby cards or fliers for films starring Don Coleman and Ben Corbett ( The Bronc Stomper (1928)), William Conklin ( The Drifters (1919)), William Duncan ( Playing It Wild (1923)), Dustin Farnum ( The Squaw Man (1914)), William Farnum ( The Gunfighter (1916)), Francis Ford ( Custer's Last Stand (1912)), Hoot Gibson ( King of the Rodeo (1929)), Neil Hamilton ( Desert Gold (1926)), Kenneth Harlan ( The Virginian (1923)), Buck Jones ( The Timber Wolf (1925)), George Larkin ( Beauty and the Bandit (1921)), Jack Luden ( Shootin' Irons (1927)), John Mason ( The Fatal Card (1915)), Frank Mayo ( The Red Lane (1920)), Ken Maynard ( The Glorious Trail (1928)), J. P. McGowan ( Discontented Wives (1921)), Malcolm McGregor ( Broken Chains (1922)), Burr McIntosh ( My Partner (1916)), Pete Morrison ( The Ghost City (1923)), Conrad Nagel ( The Michigan Kid (1928)), Charles Ray ( Deuce of Spades (1922)), Lewis Stone ( The Golden Snare (1921)), and Ernest Torrence ( Broken Chains (1922)).

Lobby cards and fliers for films starring the following actresses are present: Mary Astor ( Rose of the Golden West (1927)), Ann Cornwall ( The Rainbow Trail (1925)), Grace Cunard ( Custer's Last Fight (1912)), Bebe Daniels ( Rio Rita (1929)), Josephine Hill ( Beauty and the Bandit (1921)), Edith Johnson ( Playing It Wild (1923)), Jacqueline Logan ( Salomy Jane (1923)), Louise Lorraine ( Three in Exile (1925)), Bessie Love ( Sundown (1924)), Shirley Mason ( Desert Gold (1926)), Doris May ( The Gunfighter (1923)), Colleen Moore ( Broken Chains (1922)), Gloria Swanson ( Station Content (1918)), Alice Terry ( Sackcloth and Scarlet (1925)), and Lois Wilson ( The Drifters (1919)).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I, Lobby Cards and Fliers is organized by film title. Posters and fliers for each film title are arranged alphabetically.
